ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: French 140, like most of the previous french classes, is certainly time consuming and a lot of work. But I think that relative to earlier levels (I have only taken 130) the reward from this class is greater. I feel as though I am actually capable of sustaining conversation in French, and also have a much better hold on the grammar of the language.
Fun course that finishes up the essential grammar of the language. Also improves speaking, listening, and reading.

Yes, I would recommend French 140, particularly because it offers consistent opportunities for the improvement of spoken French. Nonetheless, all elements of language-learning are covered thoroughly. Even though this is not explicitly a French literature course, French 140 offers a great variety of readings, particularly from around in the francophone world in the "Diversite" anthology. Engaging with these pieces is truly eye-opening and fascinating for those interested in literature from the developing world.
